title.narrative: OUTPUT 4.4. EMERGENCY RESPONSE Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH)

description.narrative: By end 2021, in targeted zones, the Ministry of Public Health, the Ministry responsible for water and sanitation and Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) partners, including NGOs, have the capacity to plan for and respond to emergencies as regards installation and supply of drinking water and hygiene services, which contributes to Sanitation, Sanitation (Covid), Wash And Emergencies, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 4: By the end of 2021, women and children in the 11 target regions, especially the most vulnerable, make greater and sustainable use of safe drinking water and sanitation services and adopt good hygiene practices to prevent diseases.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end 2021, in targeted zones, the Ministry of Public Health, the Ministry responsible for water and sanitation and WASH partners, including NGOs, have the capacity to plan for and respond to emergencies as regards installation and supply of drinking water and hygiene services

description.narrative:
Despite the complexity of the humanitarian situation in Chad, UNICEF assisted 140,361 people (68,077 men / boys and 72,284 women / girls) out of a target of 68,475 to access drinking water services, equivalent to 205 per cent of the target. As part of the response to the nutritional crisis, 73,884 severe and acutely malnourished children (33,557 boys and 40,327 girls) were assisted against a target of 65,000 (114 per cent). Integration of interventions helped trigger 310 CLTS villages and provided 10 nutrition centres in 10 communities with sustainable solar-powered drinking water systems and separate latrines for women and men.
| Status:Constrained | As-of Date:08/02/2020

title.narrative: People in humanitarian situations who access safe drinking water as per agreed sector/cluster coordination standards and norms
